To the Editor: Frederick Thayer [ Letters, Jan. 18 ] says that when the Environmental Protection Agency and the Surgeon General join hands to argue that environmental tobacco smoke is a danger to non-smokers, the public should suspect a conspiracy. A more normal reaction would be to have increased confidence in the assertion that passive smoking is a major health hazard.

Mr. Thayer claims that the Surgeon General and the E.P.A. are pawns in a Reagan Administration conspiracy to divert attention from nuclear waste, power plant leaks and acid rain damage. Can he explain why the American Cancer Society, the American Lung Association, and the American Heart Association have come to the same conclusion as the Surgeon General and the E.P.A.? WESLEY O. RUPEL Bellevue, Wash., Jan. 24
